Description: Book of the Dead of Anhay; frame 7; full colour vignettes; blue border at top, yellow/red at bottom. Anhay worshipping the creator god with text. Vignette of a mummified god on stepped mound and vignette of sun being raised from primeval waters.
Curator's comments: Published: R. Freed, A Divine Tour of Ancient Egypt, Memphis 1983, pp. 28, 92-95 [9, 74]; N. Strudwick, Masterpieces of Ancient Egypt, London 2006, pp. 236-7.
Bibliographic references: Quirke 1993 / Owners of funerary papyri in the British Museum (14)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (134517) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/134517)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1983 Sep-Dec, Memphis, Art Gallery of Memphis, A Divine Tour of Ancient Egypt
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: bleached, fragile, loss Black ink Red ink Pigment Backed: brown paper Displayed in Room 62 until 1997 Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: cloth Uv filtering perspex Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: C Curatorial condition comment: fair
Acquisition name: Purchased through: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
